result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:08 AM Cases called: 22CF266 and 22CF348. Defendant Michael J. Heitke in court.  Attorney Richard G. Davis Jr. in court for Michael J. Heitke.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Davis stated this is resolved, he is waiting for discovery, requested a plea/sentencing after Nov. 1st. 10:08 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Appointed Attorney Rich Davis, with payment schedule
Return date on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:07 AM Cases called: 22CF266 and 22CF348. Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael J. Heitke in court. Defendant would like to have an attorney. Stated he filed for a court appointed attorney. Case will be recalled. 9:08/9:21 Case recalled. Court found the defendant indigent, appointed attorney Rich Davis. Defendant is to pay $100.00 per month starting 9-1-22. 9:24 AM
Return date scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Petition for court appointed attorney mailed to defendant per request.  Address verified.
Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Standard felony conditions.
Pretrial 7-22-22 at 10:20 AM and Return date 8-8-22 at 9:00 AM

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael J. Heitke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch appeared by video for Michael J. Heitke. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. Court set $1000.00 signature bond. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 1:31 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Return date scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
